Based on your preferences for war-themed movies with strong performances, I would recommend "Lincoln" as one of your top picks.

"Lincoln," directed by Ron Howard and starring Joseph Gordon-Levitt in the title role, is a historical drama film set during the American Civil War era.

The movie revolves around the life of Abraham Lincoln, the 16th President of the United States.

The movie covers some significant events that occurred during the American Civil War era.

Some of the notable events covered in the movie include:

- The Emancipation Proclamation issued by President Abraham Lincoln on January 31, 1863, declaring all slaves within the Confederate States of America (CSA) to be "free people of color" and setting a date of July 4, 1865, for their freedom.
- The Draft of Constitution of the Confederate States of America adopted by the Confederate Congress on March 25, 1861.
- The Battle of Bull Run (First Manassas Battle) fought between Union troops led by General Ulysses S. Grant and Confederate troops led by General Joseph E. Johnston and Confederate commander General Robert E. Lee at the Manassas National Battlefield Park in Prince George's County Virginia on August 29, 1862.
- The Battle of Antietam (Second Manassas Battle) fought between Union troops led by General Ulysses S. Grant and Confederate troops led by General Joseph E. Johnston and Confederate commander General Robert E. Lee at the Manassas National Battlefield Park in Prince George's County Virginia on September 14, 1862.
- The Battle of Wilderness (First Manassas Battle) fought between Union troops led by General Ulysses S. Grant and Confederate troops led by General Joseph E. Johnston and Confederate commander General Robert E. Lee at the Manassas National Battlefield Park in Prince George's County Virginia on June 15, 1862.
- The Battle of Wilderness (First Manassas Battle) fought between Union troops led by General Ulysses S. Grant and Confederate troops led by General Joseph E. Johnston and Confederate commander General Robert E. Lee at the Manassas National Battlefield Park in Prince George's County Virginia on June 15, 1862.
